title: Problem Solving Skills for Engineering Managers
description:
Engineering and technology managers often have to deal
with problems that go beyond their technical domains.
This module introduces engineering students to a
systematic methodology of problem-solving. The core of
this milestone- based method is a structured process
comprising 8 stages as well as the relevant tools and
techniques. The emphasis is on providing students with a
complete picture of the whole problem-solving process,
rather than focusing in depth on certain elements of
problem-solving (e.g., creative thinking or decision
making).
The module will focus on problems that are multi-faceted,
where solutions are likely to involve trade-offs between
technology, people, process, culture, etc. The module will
be conducted in the spirit of experiential learning, and at
the same time provide students with the theoretical
understanding of the methodology and its tools and
techniques.
